title: Improve usage of variables in MergeRequest model spec
description:
The spec for [EE::MergeRequest](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb) contains top-level variables that are overrided and needs some improvements:

- [`let(:project) { create(:project, :repository) }`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb#L14) is overrided in other examples [1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb#L147) [2](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb#L204) [3](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb#L363) and more. Concider using only top-level definition of `project` and also define it with `let_it_be` to improve performance.

- [`merge_request`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb#L16) is defined as `subject` but it's overrided in following examples as well [1](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb#L189) [2](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb#L385) [3](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/a7a1578867d72b6cf71c0cfe8d5404398ad9190b/ee/spec/models/merge_request_spec.rb#L70) and more. Concider defining `merge_request` with `let_it_be` and remove top level `subject`.

title: Migrate button styles in _ide_theme_overrides.scss to use box-shadow instead of border
description:
## The issue

As per https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/3914, a migration is underway to replace all existing `<button>` and it variant elements with `<gl-button>`. The new `<gl-button>` doesn't use `border` at all and uses `box-shadow` to define borders instead. This means that all the button theme overrides defined for the Web IDE in `_ide_theme_overrides.scss` need to be migrated to use `box-shadow` instead.

We would need to retain the old border based styles as well, until _all_ buttons in the Web IDE are replaced with `<gl-button>`. Or release all button replacements in the Web IDE in a single MR. (Individual button changes can be reviewed against the MR that fixes this issue and then we can merge the final MR.)

title: Bug with visibility levels in snippets when VUE is enabled
description:
In the Admin settings, there are a couple of things we can configure regarding visibility levels for snippets.

One of them is to `Restrict level visibility`. This setting affect several resources, not only snippets:

![image](/uploads/b90732bb692c3cef9ad7919bb2b2b404/image.png)

Note: Once the setting is set, you have to browse the snippet form view as a non admin user.

The other setting we have is to select the default snippet visibility level:

![image](/uploads/60ac7d7cd3950f5aed1694e7a0178fcc/image.png)

At the moment we're not respecting those settings and we show the three visibility levels and setting `private` as the default.

/cc @dmishunov @rkuba

title: Review apps not allowing login with root password provided by REVIEW_APPS_ROOT_PASSWORD CI var
description:
### Summary

Review apps not allowing login with root password provided by REVIEW_APPS_ROOT_PASSWORD CI var.

This is resulting the `review-qa-smoke` job to fail

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run the `review-deploy` job on any MR.
2. Go to the deployed review apps URL (such as https://gitlab-review-tz-update-j8vc3l.gitlab-review.app/users/sign_in) and try logging in.


### Example Project

https://gitlab-review-tz-update-j8vc3l.gitlab-review.app/users/sign_in

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Unable to login to review apps

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

User should be able to login to review apps with username `root` and password from REVIEW_APPS_ROOT_PASSWORD 

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![Screenshot_2020-08-26_at_12.19.56_PM](/uploads/12ce916b587fe0650cb306ad4e9ce875/Screenshot_2020-08-26_at_12.19.56_PM.png)

This bug happens on GitLab.com

title: Update all DAST on-demand scan GraphQL endpoints to return the payload
description:
### Problem to solve

Currently, most ~GraphQL mutations respond with the `payload` but the DAST on-demand scan mutations all return the ID. The purpose of this issue is to bring the DAST on-demand scan mutations inline with the others. 

The following discussion from !40208 should be addressed:

- [ ] @dbalexandre started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/40208#note_402062406):  (+1 comment)

    > I noticed that the other mutations return the resource along with the errors instead in case o success/error. Something like this:
    > 
    > ```diff
    > diff --git a/ee/app/graphql/mutations/dast_scanner_profiles/update.rb b/ee/app/graphql/mutations/dast_scanner_profiles/update.rb
    > index 0e8e85024db..ecb740330d7 100644
    > --- a/ee/app/graphql/mutations/dast_scanner_profiles/update.rb
    > +++ b/ee/app/graphql/mutations/dast_scanner_profiles/update.rb
    > @@ -39,11 +39,7 @@ module Mutations
    >          service = ::DastScannerProfiles::UpdateService.new(project, current_user)
    >          result = service.execute(service_args)
    >  
    > -        if result.success?
    > -          { id: result.payload.to_global_id, errors: [] }
    > -        else
    > -          { errors: result.errors }
    > -        end
    > +        { dast_scanner_profile: result[:payload], errors: result.errors || [] }
    >        end
    >  
    >        private
    > ```
    > 
    > What do you think about this approach?

/cc @philipcunningham


### Affected Mutations
- [ ] DAST Site Profile mutations
  - [ ] `dastSiteProfileCreate`
  - [ ] `dastSiteProfileUpdate`
- [ ] DAST Scanner Profile mutations
  - [ ] `dastScannerProfileCreate`
  - [ ] `dastScannerProfileUpdate`

title: Improve the abillity to search for settings using navbar dropdown
description:
## Problem to solve

GitLab has become so full of Settings and features it can be difficult to find it all. 

Setting Search integrated in to the top search bar makes it much easier for users to find settings and might even help discover setting they were unaware of. 

## Proposal

Re: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/Product/-/issues/1449#note_402054568

Enhance the existing experience by Adding more entries to the dropdown autocomplete experience. 

DEMO:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OE9b0Qc6KaI

## Issues (WIP- Need to add the issues for these tasks)
- [ ]  Provide a list of all the items that we want to include. This should also include target words for each (No MR)
- [ ]  Update Missing Anchor Tags (MR)
- [ ]  Add the Static List - MVC 
- [ ]  Add the ability to Track usage (example % used over time compared to Searches, Top selected terms)
- [ ]  Add the words `<keyword> In settings` To make it more clear this will not direct you to a search result page. 
- [ ]  Documentation for the feature.
- [ ]  (optional) PMM to provide a way to promote that we built this feature from listening to our customers. 
- [ ]  (optional) TAM follow ups from users that might have asked for this directly. 
- [ ]  (optional) Sales notified that this feature should be used in Demos. prospects will want to know how to find information without contacting us.


CC: @DylanGriffith @adawar @joshlambert 

Note  : This issue will be used to generate a release post.

title: GitLab::Analytics feature flag cleanup
description:
### Problem to solve

Feature flags are supposed to be temporary, but there are many long-lived feature flags in the `GitLab::Analytics` space.

### Proposal

All `GitLab::Analytics` feature flags that are more than 3 months old should either:

1. Be deleted immediately.
1. Have an issue documenting when they will be deleted.

### Related links

This problem was noted by @drewcimino in [Slack#g_manage_analytics](https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/CJZR6KPB4/p1598388039030900) on 2020-08-25:

<details>
Hi Analytics :wave: I recently implemented a new EE feature with a flag in GitLab::Analytics, and noticed the flags in here look longer-lived than most of our feature flags. Is there a separate strategy we have for these particular features? Is this an EE thing? I haven't found anything about it to read and I'm not sure where to look next
</details>

title: Set improved_mr_merged_at_queries feature flag to enabled by default
description:
### Problem to solve

The `improved_mr_merged_at_queries` feature flag was introduced in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/39329.  In https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/40138#note_401445411, @ahegyi noted "I think we can enable it by default now, since it's working as expected."

### Proposal

The `improved_mr_merged_at_queries` feature flag should be enabled by default.

description:

However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

As a DAST user, I want to access the profile library so that I can create site and scanner profiles.


### Intended users

* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)

title: Warn DAST users that host override cannot be used with API specification file import
description:
When importing an API specification for a DAST API scan, users can set `DAST_API_HOST_OVERRIDE` to target a different host than the one specified in the API specification.

However, this only works when importing the specification from a URL. The host override is ignored when the specification is imported from a file, but this isn't clear to users.

- [ ] Log a warning when host override is used with a file API spec
- [ ] Note in the docs that host override only works with a URL API spec
